intro: Micranthes octopetala, commonly known as the eight-petaled saxifrage, is a flowering plant native to the northern United States and Canada. It is a member of the Polygonaceae family, characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, rocky habitats such as stream banks and wet meadows. Its flowers are usually pink to white, with eight petals, and it blooms from late spring to early summer. The species is noted for its delicate appearance and its role in supporting local insect populations.
